channel.title: Comments on: UCT MAM1000 lecture notes part x – summary

item.title: By: Azhar Rohiman
item.dc:creator: Azhar Rohiman
item.description:
When finding the real part of (1- sqrt(3))^31, you wrote sqrt(2) instead of 2. And in the last example, when using the quadratic formula to find z. I think you missed a -sqrt(2) and wrote -2 instead.
RHMMUH005
item.content:encoded:
When finding the real part of (1- sqrt(3))^31, you wrote sqrt(2) instead of 2. And in the last example, when using the quadratic formula to find z. I think you missed a -sqrt(2) and wrote -2 instead.

RHMMUH005

item.title: By: Jonathan Shock
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Shock
item.description:
Think about having e^z=-1.
The modulus of this is 1 and the argument is i\pi+2 n \pi i, so we can write -1=1 e^{i\pi+2n\pi i}. This is where the factor comes from. Does this make sense?
J
item.content:encoded:
Think about having e^z=-1.

The modulus of this is 1 and the argument is i\pi+2 n \pi i, so we can write -1=1 e^{i\pi+2n\pi i}. This is where the factor comes from. Does this make sense?

J

item.title: By: Rohin Jain
item.dc:creator: Rohin Jain
item.description: For the second last problem. When you convert to mod arg form. I don't understand where the i times pi comes from. Please explain
item.content:encoded: For the second last problem. When you convert to mod arg form. I don’t understand where the i times pi comes from. Please explain
